alert.note: Alert for Burleigh (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 6:50PM CDT until June 20 at 9:30PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central North Dakota, including the following counties, Burleigh and Morton. * WHEN...Until 945 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in the usual low spots and underpasses in Bismarck and Mandan is expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 645 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts 1 to 2 inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bismarck, Mandan and Lincoln.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
